intro: Parasenecio levingei, commonly known as the Levinge's parasenecio, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky or arid environments, showcasing adaptations to drought and nutrient-poor soils. Its leaves are usually narrow and covered in fine hairs, while its flowers range from yellow to white in color. This species is of interest to botanists due to its unique ecological niche and potential medicinal properties.
